posts.post_content:
So, the other day I decided I wanted to stop being the guy that always loses at magic, so I went out and got some storm crows, rite of replications, and followed footsteps. I now use a mono-green control deck that splashes blue for these cards and white for [niveous wisps](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=niveous wisps). I had my opponent at 6 life with 5 storm crows out when I played [Akroma's Memorial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma's Memorial) and a kicked [Rite of Replication](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Replication). I attacked and won, but I accidentally left a storm crow out on the table. That night, while I was brushing my teeth, I heard some loud crashes and ran out of the bathroom to see what was going on. I saw a vague shape and a few dark feathers disappear into the shadows. All of my footy pajamas were missing, and when I woke up at midnight, I heard cawing and saw them on the ceiling, shredded, spelling "winter unending." I ran out and haven't been back since.  
  
For some hymns in reverence to the great Storm Crow (the guy obviously named himself ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
So, the other day I decided I wanted to stop being the guy that always loses at magic, so I went out and got some storm crows, rite of replications, and followed footsteps. I now use a mono-green control deck that splashes blue for these cards and white for niveous wisps. I had my opponent at 6 life with 5 storm crows out when I played Akroma's Memorial and a kicked Rite of Replication. I attacked and won, but I accidentally left a storm crow out on the table. That night, while I was brushing my teeth, I heard some loud crashes and ran out of the bathroom to see what was going on. I saw a vague shape and a few dark feathers disappear into the shadows. All of my footy pajamas were missing, and when I woke up at midnight, I heard cawing and saw them on the ceiling, shredded, spelling "winter unending." I ran out and haven't been back since.

Posted By: Gameguy602 (4/28/2012 10:08:28 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Storm Crow puts you on a 23 turn win-clock, which is faster than 26-turn [Chimney Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chimney Imp). Synergizes with blue tempo-counterspell cards to stop your opponent from even touching your already OP Crow. It can peck [Jace the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace the Mind Sculptor )  to death and dodge [Stormtide Leviathan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stormtide Leviathan). It comes out 4 turns earlier than [Frost Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frost Titan) and even that doesn't have flying. Wizards had to invent [Spell Snare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spell Snare) just to slow this card down. It goes without saying that I took out all the aforementioned cards from my MUC deck because because this was a much better win condition. On top of all of that, you can discard Storm Crow for [Force of Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Force of Will) which, by extension, knocks-out every combo-deck in legacy, modern, or extended (something you can't do with Tarmogoyf or even Chimney Imp). I would rather play against 4-copies of each of the Power Nine, than play against one copy of Storm Crow.  
  
I us... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Storm Crow puts you on a 23 turn win-clock, which is faster than 26-turn Chimney Imp. Synergizes with blue tempo-counterspell cards to stop your opponent from even touching your already OP Crow. It can peck Jace the Mind Sculptor to death and dodge Stormtide Leviathan. It comes out 4 turns earlier than Frost Titan and even that doesn't have flying. Wizards had to invent Spell Snare just to slow this card down. It goes without saying that I took out all the aforementioned cards from my MUC deck because because this was a much better win condition. On top of all of that, you can discard Storm Crow for Force of Will which, by extension, knocks-out every combo-deck in legacy, modern, or extended (something you can't do with Tarmogoyf or even Chimney Imp). I would rather play against 4-copies of each of the Power Nine, than play against one copy of Storm Crow.

posts.post_content:
@RetroGamer3  
What? That's not it at all.  
  
This card is rated so high because it is the strongest card ever printed. It has so many versatile uses.  
  
@at0micpickle  
It's a 1/2 **flying** for 2. You will never understand the power of storm crow.  
  
Better power/toughness than [tarmogoyf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=tarmogoyf) when the graveyards are empty, and it has flying. That's ridiculous. It even trades with [dark confidant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dark confidant). Better stats than [arcbound ravager](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=arcbound ravager) as well.  
  
Those are some of the best 2-drops in the entire game. They can't even touch this. They don't even have flying.  
  
EDIT  
Another note:  
This card is legal in modern, but wasn't reprinted in modern masters, but the above cards I mentioned were. It's because this card is too powerful to be printed again.
posts.html:

This card is rated so high because it is the strongest card ever printed. It has so many versatile uses.

Better power/toughness than tarmogoyf when the graveyards are empty, and it has flying. That's ridiculous. It even trades with dark confidant. Better stats than arcbound ravager as well.

Those are some of the best 2-drops in the entire game. They can't even touch this. They don't even have flying.

EDIT

This card is legal in modern, but wasn't reprinted in modern masters, but the above cards I mentioned were. It's because this card is too powerful to be printed again.

posts.post_content:
This card can actually be pretty good, you just have to go through a few steps:  
  
1) Play [Storm Crow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Storm Crow) during Turn 2  
  
2) Play [Moonlace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Moonlace) on Storm Crow.  
  
3) Swing out with Storm Crow for flying *colorless* damage.  
  
  
  
The game is as good as over.
